item.title: Which supplements are often taken for healing hairline bone fractures
item.description:
• Calcium
      • Vitamin D
      • Vitamin C
      • Vitamin K
      • Magnesium
      • Protein
      • Omega-3 Fatty Acids
      • Zinc
      • Lysine and Proline
      • Multi-Nutrient Supplements
      • See also: Silicon, Vitamin D and Bone Health - multiple studies

Supplements commonly taken to aid in the healing of hairline bone fractures include:

Calcium

  • Essential for bone strength and repair.

  • Recommended daily intake varies by age and gender, typically around 1,000-1,200 mg per day for adults.

item.title: Need 2X Vitamin D and other micronutrients if eat 2X more calories
item.description:
• The science of micronutrients in clinical practice – Report on the ESPEN symposium
      • Note: Most farmers and vets know this, but very few doctors

The science of micronutrients in clinical practice – Report on the ESPEN symposium

ESPEN ENDORSED RECOMMENDATION| VOL 43, # 1, P268-283, Jan 2024 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.clnu.2023.12.006

Background & aims

The European Society for Clinical Nutrition and Metabolism published its first clinical guidelines for use of micronutrients (MNs) in 2022. A two-day web symposium was organized in November 2022 discussing how to apply the guidelines in clinical practice. The present paper reports the main findings of this symposium.
